oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Making window screens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A group of students are making window screens. The completed screens would probably have been used to keep out mosquitoes.

Dr. Harry Mustard worked in Rutherford County, Tennessee, during the 1920's on behalf of the Rockefeller Foundation's Commonwealth Fund. He took photographs as part of a five-year study of health and sanitation conditions of rural children. Dr. Mustard went on to become a very prominent public health administrator.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mustard, Harry S. (Harry Stoll), 1889-1966
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rural health--Tennessee; Sanitation--Tennessee; Public health--Tennessee
African Americans; Windows; Construction; Screens
